rule.name: Line Length Extended
rule.description: Checks for long lines.

param.description: Pattern for lines to ignore.
Maximum allowed line length.
Number of characters to count for each tab character.
Check class declaration length.
Check constructor declaration length.
Check field declaration length.
Check method declaration length.

rule.name: Interface type parameter name check
rule.description: Checks that interface type parameter names conform to a format specified by the format property.

param.description: Regex that interface type parameter names must to conform.

rule.name: Cause Parameter In Exception
rule.description: Checks that any Exception class which matches the defined className regexp have at least one constructor with Exception cause as a parameter.

param.description: The regexp for the names of classes, that should be checked. Default value = ".+Exception".
The regexp for the names of classes, that should be ignored by check.
The names of classes which would be considered as Exception cause, separated by comma. Default value = "Throwable, Exception".

rule.name: Child Block Length
rule.description: This check detects the child blocks, which length is more then 90% of parent block length.

param.description: Option to switch the block types that will be checked.
Maximum percentage ratio between the child block and the parent block. Default value = 90%.
Maximum number of lines of which block body may consist to be skipped by check.

rule.name: Diamond Operator For Variable Definition
rule.description: Highlights variable definition statements where diamond operator could be used

rule.name: Avoid Condition Inversion

param.description: Avoid condition inversion only with relational operands.

rule.name: Forbid Wildcard As Return Type
rule.description: Prevents using wildcards as return type of methods.

param.description: Check public methods.
Check protected-package methods.
Check protected methods.
Check private methods.
Check overrided methods.
Check deprecated methods.
Allow wildcard with "super". Example: "? super T".
Allow wildcard with "extends". Example: "? extends T".
Ignore regex for return type class names.

rule.name: No Main Method In Abstract Class
rule.description: Forbids main methods in abstract classes. Rationale: existance of 'main' method can mislead a developer to consider this class as a ready-to-use implementation.

rule.name: Avoid Constant As First Operand In Condition
rule.description: If comparing values, C(C++) developers prefer to put the constant first in the equality check, to prevent situations of assignment rather than equality checking. But in Java, in IF condition it is impossible to use assignment, so that habit become unnecessary and do damage readability of code. In C(C++), comparison for null is tricky, and it is easy to write "=" instead of "==", and no complication error will be but condition will work in different way.

param.description: Target Constant Types.

rule.name: Avoid default implementation of serializable interface
rule.description: This check prevents the default implementation Serializable interface in inner classes (Serializable interface are default if methods readObject() or writeObject() are not override in class). Check has option, that allow implementation only one method, if it true, but if it false - class must implement both methods. For more information read 'Effective Java (2nd edition)' chapter 11, item 74, page 294.

param.description: Allow partial implementation for serializable interface.

rule.name: Avoid Hiding Cause of the Exception
rule.description: Warns when you try to hide cause of an exception when rethrowing.

rule.name: Avoid Modifiers For Types
rule.description: Disallow some set of modifiers for Java types specified by regexp.

param.description: The regexp defines the names of classes, that could not have 'final' modifier.
The regexp defines the names of classes, that could not have 'static' modifier.
The regexp defines the names of classes, that could not have 'transient' modifier.
The regexp defines the names of classes, that could not have 'volatile' modifier.

rule.name: Avoid using bitwise operations for boolean expressions
rule.description: Avoid using bitwise operations for boolean expressions.

rule.name: Confusing Condition Check
rule.description: This check prevents negation within an "if" expression if "else" is present.

param.description: Disable warnings if "else" block length is in "multiplyFactorForElseBlocks" time less then "if" block.
Disable warnings for all inner "if" . It is useful for save similarity.
Disable warnings for all sequential "if" . It is useful for save similarity.
Disable warnings for "if" if it expression contains "null".
Disable warnings for "if" if "else" block contain "throw".

rule.name: Custom Declaration Order
rule.description: Checks the class for a custom oder of declarations.

param.defaultValue: Field(public) ### Field(protected) ### Field(private) ### CTOR(.*) ### Method(.*)### InnerClass()

rule.name: Either log exception or throw exception
rule.description: Either log the exception, or throw it, but never do both.

param.description: Logger fully qualified class name. Example: "org.slf4j.Logger".
Logging method names separated with commas. Example: "error,warn".

description.p: This Check detects 3 most common cases of incorrect finalize() method implementation:

ul.li:
useless (or worse) finalize
protected void finalize() { super.finalize(); }

public finalize
public void finalize() { try { doSomething(); } finally { super.finalize() } }

rule.name: Forbid C comments in method body
rule.description: Forbid C-style comments (/* ... */) in method body.

rule.name: Forbid Certain Imports
rule.description: Forbids certain imports usage in class.

param.description: Package name regexp.
Forbidden import name regexp.

rule.name: Forbid Instantiation
rule.description: Forbids instantiation of certain object types by their full classname.

param.description: ClassNames for objects that are forbidden to instantiate.

rule.name: Forbid return statement in finally block
rule.description: Verifies the finally block design.

param.description: Regex for exception class name matching

rule.name: Illegal Catch Check Extended
rule.description: Check for illegal catch but with option to ignore these catches in some cases.

param.description: Allow catching when throwing some exception.
Allow catching when re-throwing exception.

rule.name: Logic condition need optimization
rule.description: This check prevents the placement of local variables and fields after calling methods in && and || conditions.

rule.name: Map Iteration In For Each Loop
rule.description: This check can help you to write the whole for-each map iteration more correctly.

param.description: If this checkbox is checked, Check will propose to replace wrong usage to value().
If this checkbox is checked, Check will propose to replace wrong usage to keySet().
If this checkbox is checked, Check will propose to replace wrong usage to entrySet().

rule.name: Multiple String Literals Extended
rule.description: Checks for multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file.

param.description: The maximum number of occurences to allow without generating a warning.

Token type names where duplicate strings are ignored even if they don't match ignoredStringsRegexp. This allows you to exclude syntactical contexts like Annotations or static initializers from the check.
Regexp pattern for ignored strings (with quotation marks).
Check to highlight all dublicates.

rule.name: Multiple Variable Declarations Extended
rule.description: Warn when declaring several variables in one line.

param.description: Turning on this option makes check not to warn on multiple variable definitions inside cycles.
Turning on this option makes check not to warn on multiple variable definitions inside methods.

rule.name: Name Convention For JUnit4 Test Classes Check

param.description: Regular expression which matches expected test class names.
Regular expression which matches test annotation names on classes.
Regular expression which matches test annotation names on methods.

rule.name: No null for collection return
rule.description: Check report you, when method, that must return array or collection, return null value instead of empty collection or empty array.

param.defaultValue: AbstractCollection AbstractList AbstractQueue AbstractSequentialList AbstractSet ArrayBlockingQueue ArrayDeque ArrayList AttributeList BeanContextServicesSupport BeanContextSupport ConcurrentLinkedDeque ConcurrentLinkedQueue ConcurrentSkipListSet CopyOnWriteArrayList CopyOnWriteArraySet DelayQueue EnumSet HashSet JobStateReasons LinkedBlockingDeque LinkedBlockingQueue LinkedHashSet LinkedList LinkedTransferQueue PriorityBlockingQueue PriorityQueue RoleList RoleUnresolvedList Stack SynchronousQueue TreeSet Vector Collection List Map Set
param.description: List of the collections that will be check.
Search null value not only into return block.

rule.name: Overridable Method In Constructor
rule.description: This check prevents any calls to overridable methods that are take place in: any constructor body (verification is always done by default and not configurable); any method which works same as a constructor.

param.description: Enables the searching of calls to overridable methods from body of any clone() method is implemented from Cloneable interface.
Enables the searching of calls to overridable methods from the body of any readObject() method is implemented from Serializable interface.
Enables matching methods by number of their parameters.

description.p: Highlight usage redundant returns inside constructors and methods with void result.
However, if your IDE does not support breakpoints on the method entry, you can allow the use of redundant returns in constructors and methodswith void result without code except for 'return;'.
2. Method with void result and empty body

param.description: If True, allow 'return' in empty constructors and methods that return void.

rule.name: Returning Boolean from Ternary Operator
rule.description: Avoid returning boolean values from ternary operator - use the boolean value from the inside directly.

rule.name: Return Count Check Extended
rule.description: Checks that method/ctor "return" literal count is not greater than the given value ("maxReturnCount" property).

param.description: maximum allowed number of return statements per method/ctor (1 by default).
Option to ignore methods/ctors which body has the linelength is less than given (20 lines by default). Set "0" to switch this option off and check all methods/ctors.

Option to ignore methods/ctors that have return statement(s) with depth value is less than N levels(scopes). 4 by default. 0 is the min depth. Depth is 0 when the "return" statement is not wrapped on one of the supported coding blocks.
Option to ignore "empty" (with no any expression) return statements in void methods and ctors. 'False' by default.
Option to set the count of code lines that will be ignored in top of all methods.
Option to set the RegExp patterns for methods' names which would be ignored by check.

rule.name: Returning Null Instead of Boolean
rule.description: Method declares to return Boolean, but returns null.

rule.name: Simple Accessor Name Notation
rule.description: This check verify incorrect name of setter or getter methods if it used field with other name.

param.description: Prefix of field's name.

rule.name: Ternary Per Expression Count
rule.description: Restricts the number of ternary operators in expression to a specified limit

param.description: Maximum number of ternary operators in expression
Ignore ternary operators in expression in case if priority level is set explicitly
Ignore ternary operators in expression in case if ternary operator is isolated in line

rule.name: Unnecessary Parentheses Extended
rule.description: Checks for the use of unnecessary parentheses.

param.description: Cancel validation setups of unnecessary parentheses in Boolean computations.
Cancel validation setups of unnecessary parentheses in Boolean computations with return state.
Cancel validation setups of unnecessary parentheses in Boolean computations with assert state.

rule.name: Useless single catch check
rule.description: Checks for the presence of useless single catch blocks.

rule.name: Check for enum values name
rule.description: Check forces enum values to match the specific pattern

param.description: Regex for Values Enumeration name to conform
Regex for Class Enumeration name to conform
Exclude method and field names regexp list (comma-separated)

rule.name: Forbid Annotation
rule.description: Forbid specific annotation of variable,methods,class,package and other.

param.description: Set of annotation's names
Array of type forbidden annotation's target.
